definition: Chen Shui-Bian (1950-), Taiwanese DPP 民進黨|民进党 politician, president of the Republic of China 2000-2008
surname Chen/Chen (c. 1045 - 479 BC), a Zhou dynasty state/Chen (557-589), one of the Southern Dynasties 南朝[Nan2 Chao2]
to lay out/to exhibit/to display/to narrate/to state/to explain/to tell/old/stale
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
small boat
flat/(coll.) to beat (sb) up/old variant of 匾[bian3]
surname Pian

sentences.english: Just read Leeao's book " The True Face of Chen Shui Bian" you will be enlightened.
sentences.chinese: 不妨读读李敖的《陈水扁真面目》，你将会茅塞顿开。

sentences.english: Mr Chen said he hoped cro -strait dialogue could resume quickly.
sentences.chinese: 陈水扁表示希望两岸能够尽快恢复对话。

sentences.english: I don't see the relation between Chen's case with anti-communism?
sentences.chinese: 陈水扁的例子同反共有什么关系呢？

sentences.english: Taiwan's High Court said Thursday evening it is extending the detention of former leader Chen Shui-bian by 2 months.
sentences.chinese: 17日晚，台湾高院裁定继续延押陈水扁两个月。

sentences.english: Chen's action was an obvious and wilful provocation and a high-stake gamble.
sentences.chinese: 陈水扁此举是明显的蓄意挑衅，也是一场豪赌。

sentences.english: KMT Chairman Ma Ying-jeou said Chen should listen to the protesters.
sentences.chinese: 国民党主席马英九说，陈水扁应该倾听民众的呼声。

sentences.english: Wen, a home builder, voted for Chen and his Democratic Progressive Party (DPP) back in 2000.
sentences.chinese: 在2000年，温为陈水扁及其民进党投票。

sentences.english: The Taipei court will decide this week whether Chen will be released or not.
sentences.chinese: 据悉，台北地院本周将裁定是否继续羁押陈水扁。

sentences.english: Mr Lien and Mr Soong asked for a meeting with Mr Chen, but have been turned down.
sentences.chinese: 连战和宋楚瑜要求和陈水扁见面，但被拒。

sentences.english: True, China has ratcheted up the threats against Chen and other pro-independence diehards.
sentences.chinese: 没错，北京进一步威胁陈水扁和其他顽固台独分子。

sentences.english: Ex-Taiwan leader gets 19 yrs in jail; no appeal.
sentences.chinese: 台湾前领导人陈水扁及其子获刑19年，没有上诉。

sentences.english: The snapshot of Chen sees him in a green exercise yard clenching his fists and jogging with a pair of blue slippers.
sentences.chinese: 照片上，陈水扁紧握双拳，脚穿蓝色拖鞋在慢跑。

sentences.english: Mr. Chen was given an 11-year prison sentence for corruption in a land deal earlier this month.
sentences.chinese: 本月早些时候，陈水扁因购地案被判入狱11年。

definition: Ma Ying-jeou (1950-), Taiwanese Kuomintang politician, Mayor of Taipei 1998-2006, president of Republic of China 2008-2016
Lee Teng-hui (1923-2020), Taiwanese politician, president of ROC 1988-2000
DPP (Democratic Progressive Party, Taiwan)/abbr. for 民主進步黨|民主进步党
Tsai Ing-wen (1956-), Taiwanese DPP politician, president of the Republic of China from 2016
Su Tseng-chang (1947-), Taiwanese DPP politician, premier of the Republic of China (2019-)
Ko Wen-je (1959-), Taiwanese independent politician, Mayor of Taipei City from 2014
William Lai Ching-te (1959-), Taiwanese DPP politician, vice president of the Republic of China from 2020
abbr. for 立法委員會|立法委员会[li4 fa3 wei3 yuan2 hui4]/abbr. for 立法委員|立法委员[li4 fa3 wei3 yuan2]
Yu Shyi-kun (1948-) Taiwanese politician
James Soong (1942-), Taiwanese politician expelled from Guomindang in 2000 when he founded People First Party 親民黨|亲民党
People First Party, Taiwan
Frank Chang-ting Hsieh (1946-), Taiwanese DPP politician, mayor of Kaohsiung 1998-2005
Hung Hsiu-chu (1948-), Taiwanese KMT politician
Hsu Hsin-liang (1941-), Taiwanese politician
Eric Chu (1961-), Taiwanese KMT politician
Chen Chi-mai (1964-), Taiwanese DPP politician, vice premier of the Republic of China (2019-)
